intro: Acetosella multifida subsp. angiocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a low-growing habit and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
